intro: Alifanus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with upright stems and clustered foliage. Alifanus thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and blue, making it a popular ornamental plant.
